Aquatic transportation: People would be able to travel underwater, opening up new transportation routes and possibilities for travel. This would also have a significant impact on shipping and logistics, as it would become more efficient to transport goods underwater.

Underwater agriculture: With the ability to breathe underwater, people could start growing crops in the ocean. This would provide a new source of food and could potentially lead to the development of new types of crops that are better suited to aquatic environments.

Underwater exploration: The ability to breathe underwater would allow scientists to explore the ocean floor and its inhabitants in greater detail. This could lead to new discoveries about marine life and the environment, and could potentially lead to new technologies and innovations.

Underwater architecture: With the ability to breathe underwater, architects would be able to design buildings and structures that are built into the ocean floor. This could lead to new and innovative forms of architecture that are both functional and visually stunning.

Underwater tourism: The ability to breathe underwater would open up new opportunities for tourism, as people would be able to explore the ocean and its inhabitants in a way that was previously impossible. This could lead to the development of new tourism industries and could provide a boost to local economies.
